name: Slow Cooker Bacon Wrapped Pork Loin
description: Because bacon makes everything better, especially when it's effortlessly slow cooked with a brown sugar glaze!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
1  3-pound boneless pork loin, excess fat trimmed

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine fig jam, mustards and orange zest; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine fig jam, mustards and orange zest; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper. Season pork loin with brown sugar mixture, rubbing in thoroughly on all sides.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper. Season pork loin with brown sugar mixture, rubbing in thoroughly on all sides.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add pork loin, and sear both sides until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add pork loin, and sear both sides until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.

recipeInstructions.text: Starting on 1 side, lay a slice of bacon, crosswise, on top of the pork, laying another slice to slightly overlap the first. Continue with remaining slices until fully covered.
recipeInstructions.name: Starting on 1 side, lay a slice of bacon, crosswise, on top of the pork, laying another slice to slightly overlap the first. Continue with remaining slices until fully covered.

recipeInstructions.text: Place pork loin into a 6-qt slow cooker; top with fig jam mixture. Cover and cook on low heat for 3-4 hours, or until completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 140 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Place pork loin into a 6-qt slow cooker; top with fig jam mixture. Cover and cook on low heat for 3-4 hours, or until completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 140 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with rosemary, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, garnished with rosemary, if desired.

review.reviewBody: So, I made this recipe last night but baked it instead of using a slow cooker. It was delicious. Used a 4 pound pork loin roast, 350 in the oven for 2 hours. The bacon was crispy and the roast was moist. Perfect!

Really easy recipe that produced amazingly tender pork loin. The only hiccup I ran into was our bacon did not get nice and crispy   as the bacon did in the sample photos here. Any suggestions to get crispy bacon?

Next time, we'd do some garlic mashed potatoes and maybe some roast apple too.

Do you think you could do this in the Instant Pot under pressure? I got rid of my slowcooker and dont' love the slowcooker function on the Instant Pot (five stars cause everything of yours is so good!)

Sounds amazing.  I cut open a pork tenderloin like a book**,  pound it flat, put sage bread dressing on the length of it, roll it up from the short end, wrap in bacon, tie it and put on your oh so delicious glaze and cook in the crock pot. I half cook bacon before wrapping pork.  **Do not cut all the way through.  This is the only way my family will eat pork..
I made this while in our COVID self Isolation....had to use what we had on hand.  So I substituted apricot jam for fig, and  it has turned out just great!
Put on to cook overnight  for Christmas dinner “delicious “ only had to brown top under the grille allowed it to cool down for ease of slicing will definitely make again, thank you for the recipe
